source_references: Journal of Trauma and Acute Care Surgery

content.title: Temporary Vascular Shunts
content.definition: Temporary intraluminal devices used to restore blood flow through injured vessels as a damage control measure, allowing delayed definitive vascular repair after patient stabilization.

concept.damage_control_surgery: Abbreviated surgery to control hemorrhage and contamination, with planned return to OR
concept.bridge_function: Bridge to definitive repair after correction of lethal triad

absolute: Combined vascular and orthopedic injury requiring external fixation
relative: Need for additional imaging or transfer

vessel_applications.venous_ligation: Often preferred to shunting for venous injuries

argyle.sizes: 10-14 Fr for smaller vessels, larger for bigger

insertion_steps: Control hemorrhage with proximal and distal clamping
Debride vessel ends to healthy tissue
Select appropriate shunt size (slightly larger than vessel lumen)
Insert into proximal vessel first, release clamp to confirm back-bleeding
Secure with vessel loops or suture ties
Confirm flow (palpate pulse, Doppler, pulse ox distal)
securing_methods: Silk ties around vessel over shunt

monitoring: Frequent pulse checks distal to shunt
Continuous pulse oximetry on affected limb

dwell_time.factors: Shunt type, vessel size, patient factors

definitive_repair.timing: After correction of lethal triad (usually 24-48 hours)

complications.patency_rates: 85-95% patency at 24-48 hours with proper technique

outcomes.limb_salvage: Significantly improved with shunt use vs ligation
outcomes.military_experience: Routine use in combat casualties with excellent results

codes.icd_10_pcs: 02HY3DZ | Insertion of Intraluminal Device into Blood Vessel

clinical_pearls: Temporary shunts = damage control for vascular injuries
Indications: lethal triad, combined injuries, physiologic exhaustion
Argyle chest tube = readily available shunt material
Secure with vessel loops (easier removal than suture ties)
24-48 hour dwell time is safe; can go longer if needed
Military experience has proven shunts save limbs and lives
learning_objectives: Know indications for temporary shunt placement
board_review_points: Secure with vessel loops for easy removal
